Posts.EditableText: I was searching the internet one day and I came across someone about Quest (Invisible) x20 licenses or something. There was a link to this site and a download. What is it?
Posts.HTML: I was searching the internet one day and I came across someone about Quest (Invisible) x20 licenses or something. There was a link to this site and a download. What is it?

Posts.EditableText: It was an order form for the previous incarnation of custom builds.
Posts.HTML: It was an order form for the previous incarnation of custom builds.

Posts.EditableText: Oh, and BTW, I think I may have found some warez copies of Quest Pro. If they are, I'll report it to you w/ a URL. If there's anything you can do about it (complain to their isp or provider etc.)
Posts.HTML: Oh, and BTW, I think I may have found some warez copies of Quest Pro. If they are, I'll report it to you w/ a URL. If there's anything you can do about it (complain to their isp or provider etc.)

Posts.EditableText: dont report them send them to me

Posts.EditableText: lol... i have little against warez for the most part, but Alex has spent a lot of time on this, and he deserves the funds for his troubles.
Posts.HTML: lol... i have little against warez for the most part, but Alex has spent a lot of time on this, and he deserves the funds for his troubles.

Posts.EditableText:
Yes if you see any warez versions please report them to me and I'll take the appropriate action.

One thing I have noticed though is that some download sites, which are affiliates of RegNow, fill their product listings with RegNow products. In this case, you'll see Quest listed as "Quest Pro" as that's the version offered for sale on RegNow. When you click a download link however (if there is one) you'll notice that it takes you to quest350.exe on axeuk.com - which is the ordinary, public, free Quest with the 30-day trial version of QDK.
